meanings.sent1: Yesterday, she brought her lunch to school.
meanings.sent2: She brought her dog to the park every day.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel brought all the acorns to its nest.
meanings.sent4: His smile brought sunshine to her cloudy day.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of fresh cookies brought everyone to the kitchen.

meanings.definition: Carried or transported to a place.
meanings.sent1: He brought the heavy boxes upstairs carefully.
meanings.sent2: The ants brought food to their anthill.
meanings.sent3: The wind brought the fallen leaves across the yard.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter brought joy to the room.
meanings.sent5: The river brought debris downstream after the storm.

meanings.definition: Caused to come to a place or situation.
meanings.sent1: The loud noise brought everyone to the window.
meanings.sent2: His actions brought attention to the issue.
meanings.sent3: The magician brought a rabbit out of his hat.
meanings.sent4: Her speech brought tears to many eyes.
meanings.sent5: The smell of popcorn brought people to the movie theater.
